content.description: Figure 1. Feeding relationships between selected organisms in the Chesapeake Bay
content.question: Figure 1 represents the feeding relationships between selected organisms in the Chesapeake Bay. Decades of overharvesting have reduced the populations of both blue crabs and rockfish. However, recent efforts have increased the number of rockfish in the bay. Based on Figure 1, what is the most likely result of the increase in rockfish?

choices.label: The population of menhaden will increase because the energy available from zooplankton will increase.
The population of menhaden will decrease because the energy resources available to them will decrease.
The population of zooplankton will decrease because the energy available from algae will decrease.
The population of blue crabs will decrease because predation by rockfish will increase.

content.answer: The population of blue crabs will decrease because predation by rockfish will increase.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
